intro: Beilschmiedia linharensis, commonly known as the Linharense beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. The fruit is a small, dark berry that contains a single seed, typical of many Lauraceae species.
